channel.title: Preacher Set
channel.description:
I'm not sure the name really matches the set because i changed my idea half way through modelling, just go with it. Hopefully my constant uploading of models will help inspire other people to post, we need more activity. Comments?
[IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/pre.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/preacherdat.jpg[/img]

item.title: Preacher Set
item.dc:creator: @Tribbinator Tribbinator
item.description:
@Tribbinator wrote:

I agree with Dylan on the symmetry. I also think that the shin guards, or the part of the boot that raises up in front of the knee, is a little incongruous with the blue part of the leg. From the side view it looks fantastic! In front I would suggest taking the “v” or dip in the blue leg part and straightening it to match the front part of the boot.

Read full topic

item.title: Preacher Set
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:8, topic:480101”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=598338.msg4208626#msg4208626 date=1359247272]

Its not bad. One thing that bugs me is that its completely symmetrical. Also, if the last image is how it looks rendered, you need to adjust the lighting, or make the materials less ‘glowy’

That is because i modeled half of it and then mirrored the other side, i do that with a few of my models. The last image is on Datmaker, i’m pretty sure it does that with all of the lighter colours.
[/quote]
Understandable. Datmaker wasnt made to display pretty lighting haha. And yeah modeling half and mirroring is something I commonly do aswell. Just a suggestion though, it always adds character to break up symmetry.[/quote]
I’ve done it with plenty of sets, i’ll probably finish and post them later. I fixed the colours to be brighter, but the whole point of the set was to be metal.

Read full topic

item.title: Preacher Set
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:3, topic:480101”][quote author=dylan_0789 link=topic=598338.msg4208622#msg4208622 date=1359246960]
Its not bad. One thing that bugs me is that its completely symmetrical. Also, if the last image is how it looks rendered, you need to adjust the lighting, or make the materials less ‘glowy’
[/quote]
That is because i modeled half of it and then mirrored the other side, i do that with a few of my models. The last image is on Datmaker, i’m pretty sure it does that with all of the lighter colours.[/quote]
Understandable. Datmaker wasnt made to display pretty lighting haha. And yeah modeling half and mirroring is something I commonly do aswell. Just a suggestion though, it always adds character to break up symmetry.

Read full topic

luna-scape:

Make some more weapons Please

I’ll make some more soon, just keep an eye out.

poopler40:

Interesting concept. lol i need to amp up my models. good job

Please don’t, i’m still trying to catch up.
